trans-unit.source: Web > Page Module
trans-unit.target: Web > Page Module

trans-unit.source: The page module is activated from the backend menu and is the primary module for all basic CMS operations you need to perform when maintaining website content.
trans-unit.target: The page module is activated from the backend menu and is the primary module for all basic CMS operations you need to perform when maintaining website content.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the module will display the page tree. Click the title of the page you wish to edit content on, and in the right frame you will see the content of the page displayed by the Page module. The page module has various modes of display of content; Columns The columns view will show Content Elements listed in the columns and in the order that they will appear on the website. A panel of buttons will allow you to hide/unhide, move and edit the elements easily. QuickEdit In QuickEdit the first element on the page will be loaded into a form right away. It will depend on the implementation of your website as well as your general preferences if you like this mode more than the columns view. Languages If your site supports multiple languages and uses the "one-tree-fits-all" concept for localization you will need this mode to control the translations of the content elements on a page. Page information The page information view shows some statistical data about a page. This includes hit statistics if available. General options In the top of the Page module you will find a row of icons that will bring you right to various features such as History/Undo (1), Create new content element (2), Move page (3), Create new page (4) and Edit page properties (5). See image below. Defining number of displayed columns [Admin] Administrators can configure the Page module to display only the content columns that the website uses. This is done by Page TSconfig (so it can be configured per branch in the page tree!) and this particular option has the object path "mod.web_layout.tt_content.colPos_list". For instance "mod.web_layout.tt_content.colPos_list = 0,3" will set the display of the "Normal" and "Border" columns only. There are many other options for customization of the Page module in the object path "mod.web_layout" and Administrators should refer to the "TSconfig" reference linked to below.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the module will display the page tree. Click the title of the page you wish to edit content on, and in the right frame you will see the content of the page displayed by the Page module. The page module has various modes of display of content; Columns The columns view will show Content Elements listed in the columns and in the order that they will appear on the website. A panel of buttons will allow you to hide/unhide, move and edit the elements easily. QuickEdit In QuickEdit the first element on the page will be loaded into a form right away. It will depend on the implementation of your website as well as your general preferences if you like this mode more than the columns view. Languages If your site supports multiple languages and uses the "one-tree-fits-all" concept for localization you will need this mode to control the translations of the content elements on a page. Page information The page information view shows some statistical data about a page. This includes hit statistics if available. General options In the top of the Page module you will find a row of icons that will bring you right to various features such as History/Undo (1), Create new content element (2), Move page (3), Create new page (4) and Edit page properties (5). See image below. Defining number of displayed columns [Admin] Administrators can configure the Page module to display only the content columns that the website uses. This is done by Page TSconfig (so it can be configured per branch in the page tree!) and this particular option has the object path "mod.web_layout.tt_content.colPos_list". For instance "mod.web_layout.tt_content.colPos_list = 0,3" will set the display of the "Normal" and "Border" columns only. There are many other options for customization of the Page module in the object path "mod.web_layout" and Administrators should refer to the "TSconfig" reference linked to below.

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_13.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_14.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_15.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_13.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_14.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_15.png

trans-unit.source: Click the Page module, then the title of a page in the page tree. The page module is now activated in the right frame, showing the content of the page you clicked in the page tree. These buttons are direct links to the History/Undo function (1), Create new content element wizard (2), Move page wizard (3), Create new page wizard (4) and Edit page properties form (5). See the links for more details.
trans-unit.target: Click the Page module, then the title of a page in the page tree. The page module is now activated in the right frame, showing the content of the page you clicked in the page tree. These buttons are direct links to the History/Undo function (1), Create new content element wizard (2), Move page wizard (3), Create new page wizard (4) and Edit page properties form (5). See the links for more details.

trans-unit.source: Quick Edit
trans-unit.target: Quick Edit

trans-unit.source: The Quick Editor gives you direct access to the form fields of the page content.
trans-unit.target: The Quick Editor gives you direct access to the form fields of the page content.

trans-unit.source: The Quick Editor is designed to cut down the number of clicks involved in getting to edit the page content. Simply by clicking the page title in the page tree you've got the first content element in the normal column loaded in the list frame. In the toolbar in the top you can select the other content elements on the page in the selector box.
trans-unit.target: The Quick Editor is designed to cut down the number of clicks involved in getting to edit the page content. Simply by clicking the page title in the page tree you've got the first content element in the normal column loaded in the list frame. In the toolbar in the top you can select the other content elements on the page in the selector box.

trans-unit.source: _MOD_web_layout:quickEdit_selElement
trans-unit.target: _MOD_web_layout:quickEdit_selElement

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_5.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_5.png

trans-unit.source: The QuickEdit view cuts of one extra click by bringing the user directly to the editing form after clicking a page title in the page tree. The record shown is always the first content element from the Normal column.
trans-unit.target: The QuickEdit view cuts of one extra click by bringing the user directly to the editing form after clicking a page title in the page tree. The record shown is always the first content element from the Normal column.

trans-unit.source: Content Elements
trans-unit.target: Content Elements

trans-unit.source: This is an overview of the content elements on this page in QuickEdit mode. Select another element to edit or click a "New" icon to create a new content element.
trans-unit.target: This is an overview of the content elements on this page in QuickEdit mode. Select another element to edit or click a "New" icon to create a new content element.

trans-unit.source: _MOD_web_layout:quickEdit, xMOD_csh_corebe:move_el_cs, xMOD_csh_corebe:new_ce
trans-unit.target: _MOD_web_layout:quickEdit, xMOD_csh_corebe:move_el_cs, xMOD_csh_corebe:new_ce

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_4.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_4.png

trans-unit.source: Overview of page content elements in the QuickEdit view. In the bottom there are links to two wizards: The "Move Content Element Wizard" and the "Create new Content Element Wizard". See the links below.
trans-unit.target: Overview of page content elements in the QuickEdit view. In the bottom there are links to two wizards: The "Move Content Element Wizard" and the "Create new Content Element Wizard". See the links below.

trans-unit.source: Listing by Column
trans-unit.target: Listing by Column

trans-unit.source: In the "Columns" view you can control the content of the web page as it is positioned in columns.
trans-unit.target: In the "Columns" view you can control the content of the web page as it is positioned in columns.

trans-unit.source: Listing by Language
trans-unit.target: Listing by Language

trans-unit.source: In the "Languages" view you can control the content of the web page as it is divided into languages and columns.
trans-unit.target: In the "Languages" view you can control the content of the web page as it is divided into languages and columns.

trans-unit.source: Article about localization | http://typo3.org/documentation/tips-tricks/multi-language-sites-in-typo3/
trans-unit.target: Article about localization | http://typo3.org/documentation/tips-tricks/multi-language-sites-in-typo3/

trans-unit.source: Page Information
trans-unit.target: Page Information

trans-unit.source: In the "Page Information" view you can see various statistics about a page.
trans-unit.target: In the "Page Information" view you can see various statistics about a page.

trans-unit.source: The page information reveals information such as the date of creation and last modification of the page and its content. You can also see the subtitle, keywords and descriptions. This information is often used on websites for meta data or searching.
trans-unit.target: The page information reveals information such as the date of creation and last modification of the page and its content. You can also see the subtitle, keywords and descriptions. This information is often used on websites for meta data or searching.

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_9.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_9.png

trans-unit.source: Language view
trans-unit.target: Language view

trans-unit.source: This view will display the available translations of the page content side-by-side. It enables users to create a new translation of a page.
trans-unit.target: This view will display the available translations of the page content side-by-side. It enables users to create a new translation of a page.

trans-unit.source: sys_language
trans-unit.target: sys_language

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_6.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_7.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_11.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_10.png,
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_6.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_7.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_11.png, EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_10.png,

trans-unit.source: In the Language view you can select to create a new translation of the page if one does not exist already. The available languages must be defined first by language records created in the root of the page tree. This example shows how page content for three languages is shown side-by-side in the Page module. In the top of the Page module you can also select between the available translations... ... and if you select any of the additional languages (here "Danish" and "German") you will see the default language displayed side-by-side with the selected language
trans-unit.target: In the Language view you can select to create a new translation of the page if one does not exist already. The available languages must be defined first by language records created in the root of the page tree. This example shows how page content for three languages is shown side-by-side in the Page module. In the top of the Page module you can also select between the available translations... ... and if you select any of the additional languages (here "Danish" and "German") you will see the default language displayed side-by-side with the selected language

trans-unit.source: Page content elements in a single column
trans-unit.target: Page content elements in a single column

trans-unit.source: The single column view will show the page content elements that define the content on this page of your website. Click an edit icon or element text to edit an element.
trans-unit.target: The single column view will show the page content elements that define the content on this page of your website. Click an edit icon or element text to edit an element.

trans-unit.source: You can also hide, delete and move elements by using the control panels. Clicking the "New content element" icon you will be able to create new content elements in between the existing elements on the page. Click the icon of a content element if you wish to access the context menu of the element.
trans-unit.target: You can also hide, delete and move elements by using the control panels. Clicking the "New content element" icon you will be able to create new content elements in between the existing elements on the page. Click the icon of a content element if you wish to access the context menu of the element.

trans-unit.source: _MOD_web_layout:columns_multi
trans-unit.target: _MOD_web_layout:columns_multi

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_1.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_1.png

trans-unit.source: Content Elements on a page are arranged in a specific order - the order they appear on the website. This order is also shown in the page module. The control panel allows you to move elements up and down as well as edit, hide and delete them. You can also just click the preview text shown here to access the editing form of the element.
trans-unit.target: Content Elements on a page are arranged in a specific order - the order they appear on the website. This order is also shown in the page module. The control panel allows you to move elements up and down as well as edit, hide and delete them. You can also just click the preview text shown here to access the editing form of the element.

trans-unit.source: Page content elements in a multiple columns
trans-unit.target: Page content elements in a multiple columns

trans-unit.source: The multiple column view will show the content of your website arranged in multiple columns. This is the case if your website supports more than one content zone and the content elements from each zone is arranged in "columns".
trans-unit.target: The multiple column view will show the content of your website arranged in multiple columns. This is the case if your website supports more than one content zone and the content elements from each zone is arranged in "columns".

trans-unit.source: _MOD_web_layout:columns_single
trans-unit.target: _MOD_web_layout:columns_single

trans-unit.source: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_12.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:cms/cshimages/pagemodule_12.png

trans-unit.source: When your website supports multiple content element zones in the template you will be able to use another column than the "Normal" column. Here the "Left" column is enabled. TYPO3 offers four columns by default, "Normal", "Right", "Left" and "Border". Their significance depends on individual implementations in the frontend templates.
trans-unit.target: When your website supports multiple content element zones in the template you will be able to use another column than the "Normal" column. Here the "Left" column is enabled. TYPO3 offers four columns by default, "Normal", "Right", "Left" and "Border". Their significance depends on individual implementations in the frontend templates.

trans-unit.source: The "Big Buttons"
trans-unit.target: The "Big Buttons"

trans-unit.source: These buttons will bring you to four most used functions in relation to building pages. From here you can edit the page properties (eg. the page title), you can move the current page to another position in the page tree, create a new page somewhere in the page tree or create new content elements on this page.
trans-unit.target: These buttons will bring you to four most used functions in relation to building pages. From here you can edit the page properties (eg. the page title), you can move the current page to another position in the page tree, create a new page somewhere in the page tree or create new content elements on this page.

trans-unit.source: xMOD_csh_corebe:TCEforms, xMOD_csh_corebe:move_el_pages, xMOD_csh_corebe:new_pages, xMOD_csh_corebe:new_ce,
